intro: Cicerbita olgae, commonly known as the Oleaginous Cicerbit, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. The plant is noted for its potential in biofuel production due to its high oil content in its seeds.
